amendments.title: An amendment numbered 13 printed in House Report 114-611 to reduce the Office of Congressional Ethics budget to FY16 levels and transfers remaining funds to the deficit reduction account.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Pearce amendment (A010) Failed by recorded vote: 137 - 270 (Roll no. 292).

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 12 printed in House Report 114-611 to prohibit use of funds under this Act to be used to deliver a printed copy of the Federal Register to a Member of the House of Representatives.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Russell amendment (A009) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 11 printed in House Report 114-611 to appropriate $2.5 million to re-institute the Office of Technology Assessment (OTA), offset from funds from the Architect of the Capitol's Capital Construction and Operations Account.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Takano amendment (A008) Failed by recorded vote: 179 - 223 (Roll no. 291).

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 10 printed in House Report 114-611 to expand the list of parties with whom the federal government is prohibited from contracting due to serious misconduct on the part of the contractors.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Grayson amendment (A007) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 9 printed in House Report 114-611 to prohibit any funds for delivering printed copies of the President's Budget to the office of any Member of the House of Representatives.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Gosar amendment (A006) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 8 printed in House Report 114-611 to prohibit any funds for delivering printed copies of the United States House of Representatives Telephone Directory to the office of any Member of the House of Representatives.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Gosar amendment (A005) Agreed to by voice vote.
On agreeing to the Blackburn amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 165 - 237 (Roll no. 290).

amendments.title: An amendment No. 4 printed in House Report 114-611 to transfer $500,000 from the Capital Construction and Operations account to the Capitol Building and House Office Buildings accounts, appropriating $250,000 to each bringing Capitol and House office buildings into compliance with General Services Administration requirements for federal buildings regarding lactation stations for breastfeeding mothers.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Welch amendment (A003) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment No. 3 printed in House Report 114-611 to require the Architect of the Capitol to conduct a feasibility study regarding the installation and operation of Capital Bikeshare stations on Capitol Grounds.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Blumenauer amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.title: An amendment No. 2 printed in House Report 114-611 to reprogram funds to create an Office of Good Jobs for the House of Representatives.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Ellison amendment (A001) Failed by recorded vote: 157 - 241 (Roll no. 289).
